site_name: The Bentall Centre, Bentalls Department Store
description: Proposed increase in height of existing 6 no. antennas by 1.5 metres.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
The siting and appearance would be appropriate in this case and would accord with policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The rating level of the noise determined by the cumulative sound emissions of the equipment hereby permitted shall be at least 5dBA lower than the existing background noise level at any given time of operation. The noise levels shall be determined 1m externally to any window at the nearest residential fa√ßade. Measurements and assessment shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard 4142:1997.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the neighbouring properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The telecommunications equipment hereby approved shall be installed and maintained in compliance with the guidelines laid down by the International Commission on Non-ionizing Radiation Protection (ICNIRP). If some or all of this equipment hereby approved fails to meet these or succeeding guidelines, then the equipment shall be immediately switched off and then removed within 28 days of the issue of written instruction by the Local Planning Authority.Reason :In granting this permission the local planning authority has had due regard to the material matter of potential public health risk, and fear of harm to public health, and this condition is necessary in order to provide adequate safeguard for public health in the short and longer term

When the equipment hereby approved is no longer used for the purposes of telecommunications operations, the operator shall notify the Local Planning Authority accordingly and, within 3 months of the operational requirement ceasing, the equipment and all associated structures shall be removed from the land and the site shall be restored to its condition as it was prior to the implementation of the permission.Reason: In order to prevent the retention of redundant equipment in the light of advances in telecommunications technology and to comply with the development plan.
application_type_full: Prior Approval: Development for electronic communications network
